data.title: Books for Teens 2024
data.meta_description: 2024 is set to be one for the books! Read on to see all that's coming this year! Follow us on Twitter (@MacmillanLib) for all book-related news, on Instagram (@Macmillan_Lib) for pretty pictures of books, and read our “Day’s YA” reviews of upcoming YA titles. Click here to view to view the Edelweiss catalog
data.text:
2024 is set to be one for the books! Read on to see all that’s coming this year!

Follow us on Twitter (@MacmillanLib) for all book-related news, on Instagram (@Macmillan_Lib) for pretty pictures of books, and read our “Day’s YA” reviews of upcoming YA titles.

Click here to view to view the Edelweiss catalog of these titles.

Winter 2024

A FRAGILE ENCHANTMENT by Allison Saft

9781250892836

Available now | 1/2/2024

Wednesday Books

Ages 13-18

In this romantic fantasy of manners, a magical dressmaker commissioned for a royal wedding finds herself embroiled in scandal when a gossip columnist draws attention to her undeniable chemistry with the groom.

“Saft breathes enchanting life into this Regency-influenced fantasy world, and the intricate worldbuilding and class politics never come at the cost of the romantic leads’ titillating chemistry or the riveting plot that drives the action forward.”

Publishers Weekly, starred review

“Fans of Regency romances will revel in this fantastical affair.” Kirkus Reviews

ARYA KHANNA’S BOLLYWOOD MOMENT by Arushi Avachat

HC: 9781250895110 | TP: 9781250895134

Available now | 1/9/2024

Wednesday Books

Ages 13-18

A YA romance where a teen girl navigates her older sister’s wedding, family and friend conflict, and a rivalry with the attractive student body president. Structured like a Bollywood film (entertaining intermission included!) This debut will make you swoon, laugh, cry, think, nod your head in agreement, and quite possibly make you get up and dance.

“Readers who pick up this debut, inspired by the sheer fun of it all, will wish for some masala chai and chaat and then put on a Bollywood number and dance, inspired by the sheer fun of it all. Lovable, frothy, and happy-making.” Kirkus Reviews

THE GETAWAY LIST by Emma Lord

9781250903990

Available now | 1/23/2024

Wednesday Books

Ages 12-18

The Summer I Turned Pretty meets People We Meet on Vacation in this sparkling and timeless romance from New York Times bestselling author Emma Lord. Inescapably romantic and brimming with Emma Lord’s signature cheer, THE GETAWAY LIST is an uplifting and romantic read that will settle into your heart and never leave.

“In this heartfelt ode to betting on oneself, Lord (Begin Again) enriches a familiar “bucket list” premise with leaps-off-the-page atmosphere and a lived-in setting. Introspective depictions of family, friend, and romantic relationships are riddled with humor and rambunctious energy in this inspired carpe diem romp through the city of dreams.”

Publishers Weekly, starred review

“An entertaining friends-to-lovers story that will have readers laughing and reflecting in equal measure.” Kirkus Reviews

INFINITY ALCHEMIST by Kacen Callender

9781250890252

Available now | 2/6/2024

Tor Teen

Ages 13-18

World Fantasy and National Book Award winner Kacen Callender brings us their explosively original YA fantasy debut. It’s dark academia, but burn the magic school down. A spellbinding novel about a quest that leads three young alchemists toward unexpected love and unimaginable power.

“Callender builds a rich environment that echoes real-world injustices and is populated by intersectionally diverse characters . . . Occasionally alternating viewpoints, political intrigue, a fascinating magic system, and heart-pounding action propel the plot and, combined with Ash’s unfurling relationships with Ramsay and the rest of the supporting cast, result in a refreshingly affirming and tender standout fantasy.”

Publishers Weekly, starred review

“Callender’s newest novel brings back familiar themes of poverty and systemic inequality and adds gatekeeping, colonization, and political machinations to this richly built fantasy world . . . ‘Energy is infinite, and love is energy, so love has the potential to be infinite, too.’ This is magical.” Booklist, starred reviw

EVEN IF IT BREAKS YOUR HEART by Erin Hahn

9781250761279

Available now | 2/6/2024

Wednesday Books

Ages 13-18

A heart-buckling ride of a romance by beloved author Erin Hahn about two teens finding out that sometimes, the hardest part of discovering what you want is getting the courage to pursue it.

“Case and Winnie’s relationship is a joy to watch unfold, every payoff feels earned, and subtle meditations on grief quietly ground tear-jerking emotional beats, making for a poignant romantic drama.” Publishers Weekly, starred review

“Through details about horses, rodeo life, and the ranch, Hahn creates a world that feels lived in, like a pair of comfy jeans . . . A deeply satisfying romance in which personal growth and dreams are realized.” Kirkus Reviews, starred review

THIS DAY CHANGES EVERYTHING by Edward Underhill

9781250835222

Available now | 2/13/2024

Wednesday Books

Ages 13-18

Dash & Lily meets Ferris Bueller’s Day Off in this whirlwind rom-com about two queer teens who spend one life-changing day together lost in New York City.

“Libraries looking to expand their LGBTQIA+ romance collection should march in double-time toward this title.” BCCB, starred review

“New York City becomes a third protagonist in the story, with details of landmarks, smells, and sounds told with accuracy and a lovely turn of phrase. Underhill’s writing style is on par with authors like Becky ­Albertalli and Adam Silvera.” —School Library Journal, starred review

“A lively, queer romance with flourishes of drama.” Kirkus Reviews

“Depictions of Abby and Leo’s gradually developing friendship as well as their interactions with the loyal supporting cast cultivate a safe and affirming space in which two queer teens discover new perspectives.” Publishers Weekly

HEARTLESS HUNTER by Kristen Ciccarelli

9781250866905

Available now | 2/20/2024

Wednesday Books

Ages 13-18

A dangerously romantic Scarlet Pimpernel-inspired fantasy with post-revolution witches from acclaimed author Kristen Ciccarelli. The thrilling start to a romantic fantasy duology where the only thing more treacherous than being a witch…is falling in love.

“Via Rune and Gideon’s alternating first-person narration, Ciccarelli persuasively imbues each side of the conflict with complexity, depicting both as being neither wholly good nor evil. The protagonists’ strong chemistry unfolds at a tense and steady pace in this high-stakes romantasy, the first in a trilogy.” Publishers Weekly

“Ciccarelli creates a world that will immediately immerse readers. Those familiar with The Scarlet Pimpernel will recognize the essence of the story in this gender-swapped fantasy reimagining.” School Library Journal

THE BAD ONES by Melissa Albert

9781250894892

Available now | 2/20/2024

Flatiron Books

Ages 14-18

New York Times bestselling author Melissa Albert returns with THE BAD ONES, a supernatural horror novel about four mysterious disappearances in a town haunted by a sinister magical history.

“The romance is subtle but sweet, the supernatural creep factor is extreme, and there are secrets aplenty in this compelling and eerie tale.” Booklist, starred review

“Albert successfully evokes adolescence’s fraught hyperreality using richly textured, authentically angsty characters and a storytelling style by turns ethereal and electric.”

Publishers Weekly

HOPE ABLAZE by Sarah Mughal Rana

9781250899316

Available now | 2/27/2024

Wednesday Books

Ages 13-18

ALL MY RAGE meets THE POET X in this electric debut that combines powerful prose and verse to explore a Muslim teen finding her voice in a post-9/11 America.

“This is an important, necessary step forward in honest, unapologetically Muslim storytelling for a teen audience.” Booklist

“Rana effectively portrays the friction between religious freedom and state-sponsored secularism, underpinned by discussion surrounding wrongful incarceration and xenophobia. The result is a thought-provoking and provocative novel about faith, family, and friendship.” Publishers Weekly

ELLIE HAYCOCK IS TOTALLY NORMAL by Gretchen Schreiber

9781250892164

Available now | 3/5/2024

Wednesday Books

Ages 12-18

The Breakfast Club meets THE PERKS OF BEING A WALLFLOWER in this big-hearted novel from debut author, Gretchen Schreiber.

“Schreiber’s debut novel is a realistic portrayal of what it means to be visibly disabled and chronically ill . . . While serious medical illnesses could be treated as grim, Schreiber infuses the pain and conflict with hope, friendship, and a romantic interest—someone who can see the real Ellie.” —Booklist, starred review

“Schreiber . . . employs witty banter and acerbic first-person narration to unravel complexities of disability identity as Ellie learns to self-advocate, redefines what “normal” means to her, and reckons with how chronic illness can affect relationships with others and oneself.” Publishers Weekly

“Honest and illuminating.” Kirkus Reviews

THE OTHER LOLA by Ripley Jones

HC: 9781250801982 | TP: 9781250340467

Available now | 3/12/2024

Wednesday Books

Ages 13-18

The sequel to Ripley Jones’s unforgettable YA thriller MISSING CLARISSA, THE OTHER LOLA is about what happens when the people you love the most are the people you can trust the least.

“A poignant, intricately plotted novel that will keep readers guessing.” Kirkus Reviews

IN THE ORBIT OF YOU by Ashley Schumacher

9781250886040

Available now | 3/19/2024

Wednesday Books

Ages 13-18

A YA story of enduring love from acclaimed author Ashley Schumacher, where a personality test reunites two friends and makes them second guess their careful plans.

“Schumacher expertly captures the acute experiences of childhood nostalgia, deep romantic longing, and the stressors of teetering on the precipice of adulthood.” Publishers Weekly, starred review

THE PERFECT GUY DOESN’T EXIST by Sophie Gonzales

9781250819185

Available now | 3/26/2024

Wednesday Books

Ages 13-18

A fanfic writer brings her favorite TV character to life in this friends-to-enemies-to-lovers novel full of humor and heart.

“Gonzales adeptly treads a tricky yet insightful balance of real life and fiction to explore the sometimes messy nature of emotions, relationships, and wish fulfillment. A secondary focus on the flaws of common fanfic tropes injects additional cleverness into this good-humored rom-com.” Publishers Weekly

“Watch out Simon Snow, there’s a new ­swoony-worthy fan-fiction boy in the YA-verse. A first purchase for all YA collections.” School Library Journal

DRAW DOWN THE MOON by P.C. Cast and Kristin Cast

9781250865168

Available now | 4/2/2024

Wednesday Books

Ages 12-18

New York Times bestsellers P.C. Cast and Kristin Cast return with a new duology set in a dark and magickal world filled with incredible danger and irresistible romance.

“A must-have for tween and teen libraries.” —School Library Journal

THE BLACK GIRL SURVIVES IN THIS ONE: Horror Stories by Desiree S. Evans and Saraciea J. Fennell

9781250871657

Available now | 4/2/2024

Flatiron Books

Ages 12-18

A YA anthology of horror stories centering Black girls who battle monsters, both human and supernatural, and who survive to the end. The bestselling and acclaimed authors include Erin E. Adams, Monica Brashears, Charlotte Nicole Davis, Desiree S. Evans, Saraciea J. Fennell, Zakiya Dalila Harris, Daka Hermon, Justina Ireland, L. L. McKinney, Brittney Morris, Maritza & Maika Moulite, Eden Royce, and Vincent Tirado. The foreword is by Tananarive Due.

“An engaging volume that breathes necessary life into the horror genre, showcasing the best of what goes bump in the night.” Kirkus Reviews, starred review

“A rich short story collection for any teen horror fan, especially those who are tired of the same old tropes.” —School Library Journal, starred review

“Using authentic voices to detail Black experiences through a horror lens, debut creator Evans and Fennell aim to ensure that Black girls survive their gruesome respective situations via a stellar lineup of 15 Black writers—including Zakiya Dahlia Harris, Justina Ireland, and Brittney Morris—in this unforgettable collaboration.” —Publishers Weekly, starred review

CANTO CONTIGO by Jonny Garza Villa

9781250875754

Available now | 4/9/2024

Wednesday Books

Ages 13-18

When a Mariachi star transfers schools, he expects to be handed his new group’s lead vocalist spot—what he gets instead is a tenacious current lead with a very familiar, very kissable face.

“A queer love letter to mariachi music and culture.” Kirkus Reviews, starred review

“In their third teen romance, Garza Villa orchestrates another masterpiece about queer youth redefining traditional customs in Texas . . . A sweet love story with the positive message that not all change is bad.” Booklist, starred review

“Positing that love and joy are life’s greatest experiences, Garza Villa crafts an earnest story that is both a quiet exploration of grief and a fierce rivals-to-lovers romance that centers the intensity and importance of passion.” Publishers Weekly

MERCILESS SAVIORS by H.E. Edgmon

9781250853639

Available now | 4/16/2024

Wednesday Books

Ages 14-19

The stunning conclusion to the Ouroboros series, a contemporary fantasy duology in which a teen, Gem, finds out they’re a reincarnated god from another world.

BLOOD JUSTICE by Terry J. Benton-Walker

9781250825957

Available now | 4/23/2024

Tor Teen

Ages 13-18

The sequel to Terry J Benton-Walker’s smash hit debut, BLOOD DEBTS, continues the story of powerful magical families, intergenerational curses, and deadly drama in New Orleans.

“A supernatural force of satisfying fury.” Kirkus Reviews

Spring 2024

THE DANGEROUS ONES by Lauren Blackwood

9781250891075

Available now | 5/14/2024

Wednesday Books

Ages 13-18

A romantic historical fantasy from New York Times bestselling author Lauren Blackwood, set in the American Civil War with vampires and people with demigod-like abilities.

“A cheeky, romantic, and thrilling revenge story.” —Kirkus Reviews

ATTACHED AT THE HIP by Christine Riccio

9781250760098

Available now | 5/21/2024

Wednesday Books

Ages 13-18

Survivor meets The Bachelor in this irresistible, romantic adventure by New York Times bestselling author Christine Riccio.

TWELFTH KNIGHT by Alexene Follmuth

9781250884893

Available Now | 5/28/2024

Tor Teen

Ages 13-18

From the New York Times bestselling author of THE ATLAS SIX (under the penname Olivie Blake) comes a YA romantic comedy and coming of age story about taking up space in the world and learning what it means to let others in.

“Chock-full of Shakespeare references and gamer culture, with nods to nerd franchises like Game of Thrones and D&D, this adorkable Twelfth Night retelling from the author of MY MECHANICAL ROMANCE is the stuff that rom-coms are made of.”

—Booklist

“A coming-of-age ­Shakespearean revamp where ­building personal connections, while unapologetically being yourself, is at the forefront of this ­romantic comedy.” —School Library Journal

“A delightful nerd romance.” —Kirkus Reviews

THE QUINCE PROJECT by Jessica Parra

9781250888518 (TP) | 9781250862778 (HC)

Available now | 5/28/2024

Wednesday Books

Ages 12-18

The Wedding Planner gets a YA makeover in this delightful and heartfelt novel.

“An earnest look at grief, expectations—and the many ways to get to a happily-ever-after.” —Kirkus Reviews

ANNIE LEBLANC IS NOT DEAD YET by Molly Morris

9781250290069

Available now | 6/4/2024

Wednesday Books

Ages 13-18

In this contemporary YA with a speculative twist, a girl brings her best friend back from the dead, but only for thirty days.

“Morris’s deft handling of the teens’ intertwining histories and the little mythologies that make up the language of adolescent friendships imbues this speculative rom-com with well-timed comedy and plenty of angst.” —Publishers Weekly

“A sweet story that combines realistic relationships with an intriguing, fantastical premise.” —Kirkus Reviews

THE GHOST OF US by James L. Sutter

9781250869760

Available now | 6/11/2024

Wednesday Books

Ages 13-18

ONE LAST STOP meets CEMETARY BOYS in this swoony YA romance from beloved author James L. Sutter.

“A light paranormal story centering on a sweet queer romance and teens navigating big changes.” —Kirkus Reviews

SIX MORE MONTHS OF JUNE by Daisy Garrison

9781250348678 (TP) | 9781250348654 (HC)

Available now | 6/11/2024

Flatiron Books

Ages 12-18

A romantic debut about the exhilarating highs and messy lows that swirl together when high school comes to an end, perfect for fans of Carley Fortune and Jenny Han.

“A solid romance debut that sensitively explores personal growth.”

—Kirkus Reviews

THE CALCULATION OF YOU AND ME by Serena Kaylor

9781250908704 (TP) | 9781250908681 (HC)

6/18/2024

Wednesday Books

Ages 13-18

A calculus nerd enlists her surly classmate’s help to win back her ex-boyfriend, but when sparks start to fly, she realizes there’s no algorithm for falling in love.

“A delightful, richly characterized slow-burn romance about figuring out what you want.” —Kirkus Reviews, starred review

“A one-sit read rom-com with lots of heart and plenty of ­sarcasm, perfect for Jenny Han or Emma Lord-aficionados.” —School Library Journal

HEIR, APPARENTLY by Kara McDowell

9781250873095 (TP) | 9781250873071 (HC)

7/9/2024

Wednesday Books

Ages 13-18

An American teen learns she may have accidentally married the King of England, only to end up stranded on a tropical island with him in this highly-anticipated sequel to The Prince & The Apocalypse.

“A romantic story with serious elements that will have readers wringing their hands and holding their breath.” —Kirkus Reviews

THE WHITE GUY DIES FIRST: 13 Scary Stories of Fear and Power by Terry J. Benton-Walker

9781250861269

7/16/2024

Tor Teen

Ages 13-18

Thirteen scary stories by thirteen authors of color in which the white guy dies first. A powerful and entertaining collection for YA readers, featuring stories from Tiffany D. Jackson, Mark Oshiro, Kalynn Bayron, Chloe Gong, and more!

“A memorable offering of imaginative frights that’s not for the faint of heart or those with weak stomachs.” —Kirkus Reviews

“These stories excel at playing with perspective, familiar tropes, and twists on murderous intent creating unique moments that reveal a bigger picture . . . Each reader will have a favorite tale in this solid horror short story collection.” —School Library Journal

DASHED by Amanda Quain

9781250907530

7/16/2024

Wednesday Books

Ages 13-18

In this contemporary update of Sense and Sensibility, Margaret Dashwood is setting sail on an adventurous summer cruise unless love sinks her first.

“Warm and witty.” —Kirkus Reviews

CASTLE OF THE CURSED by Romina Garber

9781250863898

7/30/2024

Wednesday Books

Ages 13-18

A delicious and dark gothic romance from bestselling author Romina Garber about a mysterious house that is always hungry, and the girl who must venture into its secrets.

“A brooding romance with a compelling, gothic setting.” —Kirkus Reviews

” . . . [A] smart remix of classic Austenian themes and values depicting one teen girl’s endeavor to develop a more assured sense of self. ” —Publishers Weekly

GUARDIANS OF DAWN: AMI by S. Jae-Jones

9781250191458

8/6/2024

Wednesday Books

Ages 12-18

Sailor Moon meets Beauty and the Beast in the second book in a new, richly imagined fantasy series from S. Jae-Jones, the New York Times bestselling author of WINTERSONG.

“[T]his worthwhile sequel is easy to dive into and lives up to its predecessor. An action-packed and inherently magical sequel.” —Kirkus Reviews

MYSTERIOUS WAYS by Wendy Wunder

9781250770202

8/27/2024

Wednesday Books

Ages 13-18

A beautiful, heartwarming coming-of-age tale about a girl who believes she’s God from award-winning author Wendy Wunder.

“A humorous and stimulating reading experience that offers glimpses into a girl’s exhausting inner thoughts.” —Kirkus Reviews

“[Maya is] a magnetic personality who’s wholly aware of the systemic patterns that have shaped her, a dynamic that sets the stage of this tongue-in-cheek read.” —Publishers Weekly, starred review

Fall 2024

ONE HOUSE LEFT by Vincent Ralph

9781250882189 (TP) | 9781250882165 (HC)

8/27/2024

Wednesday Books

Ages 13-18

Sixteen-year-old Nate Campbell grew up in the shadow of Murder Road – a street cursed by the vengeful spirit of the Hiding Boy. Nate and his family move to a new town as they try to outrun the curse once and for all. But, when he is pulled into his new friends’ urban legend club, new ghost stories merge with old until there is nowhere left to run.

“A suspenseful, grisly tale that’s sure to appeal to genre fans.” —Kirkus Reviews

“Ralph puts a harrowing twist on a familiar tale of teens exploring urban legends in this grim and suspenseful horror novel. ” —Publishers Weekly

WHEN HARU WAS HERE by Dustin Thao

9781250762061

9/3/2024

Wednesday Books

Ages 12-18

WE ARE OKAY meets Wandavision in this novel about loss and learning to let go from the New York Times bestselling author of YOU’VE REACHED SAM.

THE LIES WE CONJURE by Sarah Henning

9781250841063

9/17/2024

Tor Teen

Ages 13-18

Knives Out meets THE INHERITANCE GAMES with magic in this standalone supernatural thriller by Sarah Henning: thirteen witches, a locked-room murder, two non-magical sisters trapped in a deadly game of Clue.

SOME LIKE IT COLD by Elle McNicoll

9781250335531 (TP) | 9781250335517 (HC)

10/1/2024

Wednesday Books

Ages 13-18

A big-hearted small-town romance from bestselling, award-winning author Elle McNicoll. The perfect story to get lost in, SOME LIKE IT COLD centers Jasper as an autistic heroine in a big-hearted small-town romance that will melt your heart and is perfect for fans of Alice Oseman, Rainbow Rowell and Gilmore Girls

SPECTACULAR by Stephanie Garber

9781250893406

10/22/2024

Flatiron Books

Ages 13-18

Welcome, welcome back to the mysteriously enchanting world of Caraval! Return to the legendary magic and the whimsical wonder with this beautifully illustrated holiday novella.

FOR SHE IS WRATH by Emily Varga

9781250877383

10/29/2024

Wednesday Books

Ages 13-18

A sizzling Pakistani romantic fantasy retelling of The Count of Monte Cristo where one girl seeks revenge through the use of forbidden magic against the boy she once loved and those who betrayed her.

THE DEBUTANTES by Olivia Worley

9781250881465 (TP) | 9781250881441 (HC)

10/29/2024

Wednesday Books

Ages 13-18

Jessica Goodman meets THE AGATHAS in this taut, twisty YA thriller set in the glittering, dark world of Mardi Gras in New Orleans, where secrets and bodies never stay buried.

WHERE THE LIBRARY HIDES by Isabel Ibañez

9781250822994

11/5/2024

Wednesday Books

Ages 13-18

The stunning conclusion to the story that started in WHAT THE RIVER KNOWS. A lush immersive historical fantasy set in Egypt filled with adventure, and a rivals-to-lovers romance like no other!

THE WHISPERING NIGHT by Susan Dennard

9781250339485

11/19/2024

Wednesday Books

Ages 13-18

The forest is more dangerous than ever as secrets are revealed in this highly-anticipated, pulse-pounding, and swoon-worthy conclusion to the bestselling Luminaries trilogy.

NOT FOR THE FAINT OF HEART by Lex Croucher

9781250847232

11/26/2024

Wednesday Books

Ages 13-18

Lex Croucher’s next YA romance, with all the swoons, laughs, and heart-pounding moments you’d expect from a story about the granddaughter of Robin Hood and the girl she’s accidentally kidnapped.

DUST by Alison Stine

9781250878731

12/3/2024

Wednesday Books

Ages 13-18

In Alison Stine’s haunting young adult debut, a partially deaf teenager must find community and hope amidst the foreboding climate change in the Colorado Bloodless Valley.

THE RULES OF ROYALTY by Cale Dietrich

9781250887771 (TP) | 9781250887757 (HC)

12/10/2024

Wednesday Books

Ages 13-18

Two princes from neighboring countries fall into a whirlwind romance in this sparkling spin on The Princess Diaries by Cale Dietrich.

WHAT THE WOODS TOOK by Courtney Gould

9781250340672

12/10/2024

Wednesday Books

Ages 13-18

Yellowjackets meets Girl, Interrupted when a group of troubled teens in a wilderness therapy program find themselves stranded in a forest full of monsters eager to take their place.

Distribution Titles: Page Street YA, Wattpad Books, & Entangled: Teen

EVERGREEN by Devin Greenlee

9781649375377

Available now | 1/16/2024

Entangled: Teen

Ages 14+

MY BIG, FAT DESI WEDDING by Prerna Pickett

9781645679950

Available now | 1/16/2024

Page Street YA

DON’T BE A DRAG by Skye Quinlan

9781645677871

FURIOUS by Jamie Pacton and Rebecca Podos

OF PRINCES AND POISONS by Brianna Joy Crump

9781990778704

6/18/2024

THE HOUSE WHERE DEATH LIVES by Alex Brown

9798890030122

8/6/2024

Page Street YA

Ages 14+

WITTY IN PINK by Erica George

9781649375414

8/6/2024

Ages 14+

DEATH IS MY RIDE OR DIE by Katarina E. Tonks

9781990778001

8/17/2024

HELGA by Catherine Yu

9798890039514

8/20/2024

REPEAT AFTER ME by Jessica Warman

9781649375384

9/3/2024

9781649374288

AT THE END OF THE RIVER STYX by Michelle Kulwicki

9/24/2024

A VILE SEASON by David Ferraro

9798890030726

10/8/2024

WRONG ANSWERS ONLY by Tobias Madden

REST IN PEACHES by Alex Brown

9798890030702

10/15/2024

THEY WATCH FROM BELOW by Katya de Becerra

9798890030801

10/29/2024

Page Street YA

Ages 14+

ONYX by Jennifer L. Armentrout

9781649376121

11/5/2024

Entangled: Teen

Ages 14-18

THE SHADOWS RULE ALL by Abigail Owen

9781649373076

11/12/2024

Entangled: Teen

Ages 14+

CHASING ETERNITY by Alyson Noël

9781649371935

12/3/2024

Entangled: Teen

Ages 14+
